remixlab.bias.core

Interface Action<E extends Enum<E>>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - Global enum action set.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Constants.ClickAction, Constants.DOF1Action, Constants.DOF2Action, Constants.DOF3Action, Constants.DOF6Action, Constants.KeyboardAction, Constants.WheelAction

    public interface Action<E extends Enum<E>>
    Generic interface defining user action (sub)groups.

    (User-defined) global Actions in bias should be defined by a third-party simply using an Enum. This interface allows grouping items of that global action Enum together, thus possibly forming action sub-groups. Each item in the action sub-group should be mapped back to an item in the global Enum set (see referenceAction()).

    Note: User-defined actions subgroups implementing this Interface are used to parameterize Profiles which are then used to parameterize ActionAgents. The idea being that user-defined actions may be grouped together according to the BogusEvent type needed to implement them (see Grabber.performInteraction(remixlab.bias.core.BogusEvent)). Parsing the BogusEvent thus requires the proper Agent type.

    Observation Enums provide an easy (typical) implementation of this Interface. For example, given the following global Action set: 

     public enum GlobalAction {
   CHANGE_COLOR,
   CHANGE_STROKE_WEIGHT,
   CHANGE_POSITION,
   CHANGE_SHAPE
 }
    An implementation of an Action group defined with the CHANGE_POSITION and CHANGE_SHAPE items, would look like this: 
     public enum MotionAction implements Action<GlobalAction> {
   CHANGE_POSITION(GlobalAction.CHANGE_POSITION), 
   CHANGE_SHAPE(GlobalAction.CHANGE_SHAPE);
   
   public GlobalAction referenceAction() {
     return act;
   }
 
   public String description() {
     return "A simple motion action";
   }
 
   public int dofs() {
     return 2;
   }
 
   GlobalAction act;
 
   MotionAction(GlobalAction a) {
     act = a;
   }
 }

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String description()
      Returns a description of the action.
      int dofs()
      Returns the degrees-of-freedom needed to perform the action.
      E referenceAction()
      Returns group to global action item mappings.
